blurb: The “Linked Discourses with Jambukhādaka” contains 16 discourses recording the answers given by Sāriputta to the questions of a wanderer named Jambukhādaka. The questions cover a wide range of themes, from the nature of extinguishment to the difficulty of practicing the Dhamma. This chapter is practically identical to the next, differing only in the name of the wanderer.
The wanderer Jambukhādaka asks Sāriputta about extinguishment and the path to realize it.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The wanderer Jambukhādaka asks Sāriputta about perfection (arahantship) and the path to realize it.
